definitions.definition: To , toward , or from the far side of (something that lies between two points of interest).
examples: Fortunately, there was a bridge across the river.
He came across the street to meet me.

definitions.definition: On the opposite side of (something that lies between two points of interest).
examples: That store is across the street.

definitions.definition: across from: on the opposite side, relative to something that lies between, from (a point of interest).
From one side to the other within (a space being traversed).
examples: The meteor streaked across the sky.
Could you slide that across the table to me, please?

definitions.definition: At or near the far end of (a space).

examples: This poetry speaks across the centuries.
All across the country, voters were communicating their representatives.

definitions.definition: So as to intersect or pass through or over at an angle.
examples: Lay the top stick across the bottom one.
She had straps fastened across the conduit every six feet.

definitions.definition: In possession of full, up-to-date information about; abreast of.
examples: Keep across all the latest news here at Channel 10.

main_definition: To , toward , or from the far side of (something that lies between two points of interest).
secondary_definitions: On the opposite side of (something that lies between two points of interest).
( Southern US , African-American Vernacular ) across from: on the opposite side, relative to something that lies between, from (a point of interest).
From one side to the other within (a space being traversed).
At or near the far end of (a space).
So as to intersect or pass through or over at an angle.
In possession of full, up-to-date information about; abreast of.
